Description: Four heads of women, in pairs; after a painting by Andrea Michieli (Vicentino) then in the church of San Barnaba in Venice; leaf from the Italian Sketchbook (containing 121 leaves) Pen and brown ink Verso: Rest on the Flight into Egypt; after Paolo Veronese Pen and brown ink
Curator's comments: See Curatorial comment for BM 1957-12-14-207.1. After a drawing by Paolo Veronese, formerly also in Lely's collection, see 1854,0628.4. Watermark: lower half of A.
Bibliographic references: Adriani 1940 / Anton van Dyck, Italienisches Skizzenbuch (2)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Samuel William Reynolds I
Previous owner/ex-collection: George James Welbore Agar-Ellis, 1st Baron Dover (purchased from Reynolds)
Previous owner/ex-collection: Henry Agar-Ellis, 3rd Viscount Clifden (inherited from Dover)
Previous owner/ex-collection: Henry George Agar-Ellis, 4th Viscount Clifden (Christie's, 6.v.1893/36 #120.5s.6d)
Previous owner/ex-collection: Desprez (purchased at Clifden sale)
Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Herbert Cook (returned to Devonshire family)
Previous owner/ex-collection: William Cavendish, 2nd Duke of Devonshire
Acquisition notes: See Acquisition history in BM 1957-12-14-207.1 for further details of provenance.
